intro: Lachenalia ensifolia subsp. ensifolia, commonly known as the sword lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright, sword-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, often brightly colored flowers. The plant is part of the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its ability to store water in its leaves, making it drought-tolerant. It typically blooms in spring and is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, grass-like leaves and its ability to thrive in well-drained, sandy soils.
